snippet: An increasing number of the nation’s savings and loan associations are avoiding some federal oversight by becoming credit unions or switching to a state charter.
abstract: Increasing number of the nation’s more than 600 savings and loan associations are avoiding federal oversight from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency by becoming credit unions or switching to a state charter; while the banks say that they are looking for a regulatory agency that understands them, some former industry experts have expressed concern that the financial institutions are regulator shopping.
lead_paragraph: An increasing number of the nation’s savings and loan associations are avoiding some federal oversight by becoming credit unions or switching to a state charter.

headline.seo: Small Banks Shift Charters to Avoid U.S. as Regulator
